episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the use of moss in traditional Irish recipes, Shirley Temple's surprising diplomatic career, a cinema in Melbourne that once offered a cloakroom for babies, and the history of Pez dispensers as anti-smoking aids.

facts.fact: One traditional Irish recipe for Blemange involves moss.
When communism fell in Czechoslovakia, the US ambassador in the country was Shirley Temple.
There used to be a cinema in Melbourne, Australia that had a cloakroom to keep your babies in.
The original vapes were Pez dispensers.
